page.title: 08TRAFFIC ON THE ROADS
page.content: "Over the past fifty years I have seen a great deal of changes in{Crathes.} One of the biggest changes is the amount of trafficon the roads,{ {Banchory}and{Aboyne}being commuter villages for{Aberdeen.}The result is that the main road is extremely busy especially around{8am}and{6pm. The road is now the only way to travel since the railway was closed by{Dr. {Beeching}over 20 years ago. The trains used to carry the mail and papers from {Aberdeen,}however these now come by van. When I was young the castle was owned by the{Burnetts}of{Leys}who employed many servants _ a chauffeur, butler, footman, lady's maid, nanny, keeper, cook, 2 kitchen maids and 3 gardeners, plus lots of farm workers. Nowadays the castle is owned by the {NTS}who employ just 12 people."
